title: The Perfect Homemade Pizza - Step by Step
content:
Introduction

Making pizza at home is easier than you think! Follow this guide for restaurant-quality results.

Ingredients

For the Dough:

  • 500g (4 cups) bread flour or "00" flour
  • 325ml (1⅓ cups) warm water
  • 10g (2 tsp) salt
  • 7g (2¼ tsp) active dry yeast
  • 2 tbsp olive oil

For the Sauce:

  • 400g (14 oz) canned San Marzano tomatoes
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • Fresh basil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Toppings:

  • 300g (10 oz) fresh mozzarella
  • Fresh basil leaves
  • Extra virgin olive oil
  • Your favorite toppings

Instructions

Step 1: Make the Dough (2 hours)

  1. Mix warm water and yeast, let sit for 5 minutes
  2. Combine flour and salt in a large bowl
  3. Add yeast mixture and olive oil
  4. Knead for 10 minutes until smooth
  5. Let rise in covered bowl for 1-2 hours

Step 2: Prepare the Sauce (15 minutes)

  1. Crush tomatoes by hand
  2. Sauté garlic in olive oil
  3. Add tomatoes, simmer for 10 minutes
  4. Season with salt, pepper, and basil
  5. Let cool before using

Step 3: Shape the Pizza (5 minutes)

  1. Preheat oven to maximum temperature (250°C/480°F)
  2. Divide dough into 2-3 portions
  3. Stretch gently with hands (not a rolling pin!)
  4. Form a raised edge around the perimeter
  5. Place on floured surface or pizza peel

Step 4: Add Toppings (5 minutes)

  1. Spread thin layer of sauce (less is more!)
  2. Tear mozzarella and distribute evenly
  3. Add your favorite toppings sparingly
  4. Drizzle with olive oil

Step 5: Bake (10-12 minutes)

  1. Transfer to preheated pizza stone or baking sheet
  2. Bake until crust is golden and cheese bubbles
  3. Watch carefully - timing varies by oven
  4. Remove and add fresh basil
  5. Let cool for 2 minutes before slicing

Pro Tips

Temperature is Everything: Use the hottest oven setting possible. A pizza stone heated for 30 minutes makes a huge difference!

Common Mistakes to Avoid:

  • ❌ Too much sauce makes pizza soggy
  • ❌ Rolling pin makes dough dense
  • ❌ Overloading with toppings
  • ❌ Not preheating long enough

Variations

Margherita (Classic)

Just tomato sauce, mozzarella, and fresh basil.

Marinara (No Cheese)

Tomato sauce, garlic, oregano, and olive oil.

Quattro Formaggi (Four Cheese)

Mozzarella, gorgonzola, parmesan, and fontina.

Enjoy your homemade pizza! Share your results with us.
summary: Learn how to make authentic Italian pizza at home with this detailed recipe and technique guide.
author: Marco Rossi
